content.desc: Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, December 5) — Ilocos Norte Representative Imelda Marcos posted a P300,000 bail after the anti-graft court allowed her to avail of legal remedies in the wake of her graft conviction. The bail was posted Wednesday. The 89-year-old and former first lady was not required to show up. content.title: Imelda Marcos posts P300k bail to enjoy freedom post-conviction - Rappler
content.desc: MANILA, Philippines – Graft convict Imelda Marcos posted on Wednesday, December 5, her P300,000 bail to enjoy temporary freedom post-conviction. Only a lawyer posted bail on Wednesday as Marcos was not required to personally appear before the anti-graft court Sandiganbayan. The Fifth Division said her appearance during the last hearing, where she was also asked to pay a separate P150,000 bail, is sufficient. Marcos also paid P4,700 in legal fees. content.title: Sandiganbayan cites SC ruling on Enrile in granting Imelda Marcos bail - CNN Philippines
content.desc: Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, December 3) — Ilocos Norte Representative Imelda Marcos can thank former Senator Juan Ponce Enrile for the temporary freedom granted to her by the Sandiganbayan following her conviction for graft. In its decision, the anti-graft court's Fifth Division cited the former First Lady's age and health condition in granting her bail. The court added this is based on a 2015 Supreme Court decision granting Enrile bail as he faces a plunder charge at the Sandiganbayan.
